plugins.name: Find and Replace Screens
plugins.description:
Find and Replace Screens is a tool designed to streamline the process of updating screens in Figma with just one click. Whether you're transitioning from wireframes to final UI designs or updating screens across an entire flow, this plugin saves you time by keeping your layout, connectors, and arrows intact. No more manual re-positioning or reconnecting screens!


Key features:

  1. One-Click screen replacement: Update multiple instances of the same screen with a single action, ideal for projects where the same screen is used in multiple places.
  2. Preserves layout and flow: Replacing a screen won't disturb its surrounding elements, including arrows, connectors, and positions within the flow.
  3. Flexible use case: While perfect for wireframe-to-UI transitions, the plugin is also useful for updating iterations of any design screen without losing structure.


How to Use:

  1. Choose the new screen you want to use (UI design, updated iteration, etc.).
  2. Select the screen(s) you want to replace in the flow.
  3. Click "Replace Screen" to swap the content while maintaining connections and layout positions.


Limitations:

  1. For best results, ensure the new screens are similar in size to the ones being replaced, as large size differences may affect layout alignment.
  2. Does not adjust connectors/arrows if the new screen's size significantly differs from the original.
plugins.tagline: Find and Replace Screens across your project with one click while keeping connections intact.

plugins.name: VariableMaster - Swap Variables
plugins.description:
VariableMaster - Master all your variable workflows


Variable Master is your complete variable workflow solution for Figma. Switch variables between any libraries - local to published, published to local, or between different files. Whether you're swapping collections within the same file or moving components from one library to another, Variable Master makes it simple and fast.


Features :


- Swap variables between local and published libraries

- Switch collections between local variables

- Switch component variables from library A to library B easily

- Work with current selection, page, or entire file

- See what will change before you apply it

- Handle thousands of variables at once

- Pick which collections to swap or exclude specific variables


How to use :


1. Choose what to update (selection, page, or file) and pick your libraries from the drop down.

2. Select which collections to swap and see the preview.

3. Uncheck variables you don't want to change, then click on swap variables.


Ps : plugin picks libraries only if they are added in the File. You can add them to you file via Asset panel.


RoadMap :


- Find all variables used in your designs

- Export and import variable collections

- Check for design elements that need variables​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​


This Plugin is completely free to use, No charges for swapping variables.
plugins.tagline: Master all your variable workflows

plugins.name: Sliding Text
plugins.description:
Sliding Text transforms static text into engaging animated components with just a few clicks. This plugin allows designers to:


  1. Convert any text layer into a dynamic text slide component
  2. Customize animation direction (top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top, left-to-right, right-to-left)
  3. Fine-tune animation timing, stagger delay, and easing
  4. Preview animations directly in the plugin interface
  5. Create components that maintain the original text's font, size, and styling
  6. Generate a "done" state for the final animation frame


Simply select a text layer, enter your phrases or words separated by commas, choose your animation settings, and let the plugin generate a fully configured component with smart animate transitions. Perfect for creating engaging sliding text / rotating messages / dynamic text effects without any coding knowledge.
plugins.tagline: Smooth text slide animations with customizable directions and timing

plugins.name: AI Real Data Generator
plugins.description:
Description

Testing with real-life data is crucial, but setting up prototypes manually is time-consuming. With AI Real Data Generator Figma plugin, simply provide AI with your instructions and an example—using your Gemini API key, it will instantly generate and replace data in your design, making prototyping seamless and efficient.


How to Use:

  1. Add the AI Real Data Generator plugin in Figma.
  2. Enter your Gemini API key to enable data generation.
  3. Provide instructions on the type of real-life data you need.
  4. Provide an example or data template to guide AI generation.
  5. AI instantly generates and replaces data directly in your Figma design.


Key Features:


  1. Instant data generation: AI quickly fills in real-world data in seconds.
  2. Customizable: Provide specific instructions and examples to match your needs.
  3. Seamless integration: Data replaces existing placeholders in your design automatically.
  4. Efficiency boost: Save time on manual data entry during prototyping.
  5. Powered by Gemini API: Leverage advanced AI for precise data generation, enabled with the free gemini-2.0-flash modal
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma designs with real-world data using AI-powered precision

plugins.name: Accessibility Checker
plugins.description:
Make your designs accessible to everyone with this comprehensive accessibility checker. This plugin combines automated testing with guided manual review to ensure your designs meet accessibility standards.


🔍 AUTOMATED CHECKS

- Text contrast analysis against backgrounds

- Font size verification for readability

- Overlapping elements detection

- Missing alt text detection


✅ INTERACTIVE CHECKLIST

Track your progress with a persistent checklist covering key accessibility criteria:

- Contrast and readability

- Color usage and clarity

- Image descriptions and alt text

- Language simplicity

- Animation limits

- Overall design clarity


💡 EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES

Each accessibility issue includes a direct link to relevant WCAG guidelines and best practices to help you learn while you design.


Perfect for designers who want to create more inclusive products and ensure compliance with accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1). This plugin makes accessibility checking a seamless part of your design workflow rather than an afterthought.


Whether you're new to accessibility or an experienced designer, this tool helps you identify and fix issues early in the design process, saving development time and creating better experiences for all users.
plugins.tagline: Create accessible designs with automated checks and guided review

plugins.name: Showcase
plugins.description:
Showcase makes presenting specific frames to your team effortless. Whether you’re walking through a design or highlighting a particular frame, Showcase lets you do so directly within the canvas, offering smooth flyover animations for a seamless presentation. Independent of the zoom level, you have full control over how close or far you view your frames—adjust zoom as desired.


Showcase is also helpful when working with large files that contain many frames. If you ever feel lost in the canvas, Showcase helps you quickly focus on a specific frame by simply selecting it from the layers panel.


Showcase is free to use. If you find it helpful, consider supporting the project by buying me a coffee ☕️.

plugins.name: tokenXtractor - by techworks studio
plugins.description:
tokenXtractor is a Figma plugin thoughtfully crafted to make exporting local variables, or tokens, easy and accessible. Its usage is fairly straightforward: configure your options, select your collections, and then download them.


1) Configure your options


  1. Case Style
  2. Export Single File
  3. Export Format


2) Select your collections


All collections are selected by default, so if you would like to export all your collections, you can skip this step. Otherwise, click on the variable collection name to select / deselect it for export.You can select multiple using CMD + Click (MacOS) or CTRL + Click (Windows). To select a range, click the first collection and then SHIFT + Click the last collection.You can undo your selection by clicking the 'RESET' button next to 'Collections?'


3) Download your tokens


Finally, press the 'DOWNLOAD TOKENS' button, save the zip file where you'd like, and then unzip the file to access your exported tokens.


Previewing + Misc. Tips


The right half of the plugin contains a 'preview' of the tokens to be exported. When exporting multiple files, you can use the dropdown menu next to 'Previewing' to switch the collection you're viewing.


------------------------------

Brought to you by techworks.studio

------------------------------
plugins.tagline: Export local variables to code-ready files

plugins.name: コーディング計算ツール
plugins.description:
レイヤーから取得できる数値をコーディングで使用する数値に自動計算します。

あなたのコーディング作業が少しでも楽になりますように。


【行間の倍率変換】

テキストレイヤーを選択すると文字サイズと行間を取得して倍率値に変換します。

以下の場合は計算できません。

  1. 行間がautoの場合
  2. オートレイアウト、グループ化レイヤーを選択
  3. テキストレイヤー以外のレイヤーを選択


【単位変換】

px値を別の単位に変換します。

各単位共通でテキストレイヤーなら文字サイズを取得し、その他のレイヤーなら横幅を取得しますが、単位ごとに連動するフィールドが異なります。


em：

レイヤーを選択すると「基準値」が変動します。

rem：

レイヤーを選択すると「変換したいpx値」が変動します。基準値は16が初期値になります。

%：

レイヤーを選択すると「基準値」が変動します。

vw：

レイヤーを選択すると「基準値」と「変換したいpx値」が変動します。

「基準値」は一番外側のフレームサイズになり、「変換したいpx値」は選択中のレイヤーの数値になります。


【clamp関数】

レイヤーから数値を取得して、clamp(最小値, 推奨値, 最大値)の形式で出力します。

フレームサイズが700px以下の場合は最小値と最小画面幅が、701px以上だと最大値と最大画面幅が連動し、レイヤーから数値を取得します。emとremは基準値も設定できます。


【その他共通仕様】

  1. 結果をクリックでクリップボードにコピーします。
  2. 「値変動」をOFFにするとレイヤーからの取得をやめ、普通の計算機になります。
  3. 出力結果が小数点になる場合は少数第3位まで表示します。
plugins.tagline: コーディングで使用する数値に変換する補助ツール。

plugins.name: Combine Pages
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin built for designers who value organization just as much as iteration.


Whether you're wrapping up a sprint, handing off files, or simply cleaning house, Archive & Combine Pages helps you bring order to your design file with ease. Select any number of pages, and this plugin will neatly group their content into a single new page titled Archive [date]. Each page’s content is preserved as a section, spaced evenly and grouped for clarity. Once processed, original pages are renamed with an ARCHIVED_ prefix — so nothing gets lost, but everything gets tidied.
plugins.tagline: Merge pages. Archive cleanly.

plugins.name: 클로드야 번역해줘 얍-🪄
plugins.description:
Claude AI의 강력한 자연어 처리 기능을 활용하여 Figma 디자인의 텍스트를 자연스럽게 번역합니다. 단순한 기계 번역이 아닌, 맥락을 이해하고 자연스러운 번역을 제공합니다.


* Anthropic API 키가 필요합니다 *


주요 기능:

  1. 한국어, 영어, 일본어, 중국어 지원
  2. 앱 UI, 웹사이트, 구어체, 공식문서 등 다양한 번역 스타일
  3. 선택한 텍스트만 번역 또는 전체 페이지 번역
  4. 실시간 번역 진행 상황 및 상세 로그 제공
  5. Anthropic의 Claude AI 기술 활용


사용 방법:

  1. 설정에 Anthropic API 키 입력 및 테스트 > 저장
  2. 번역하고 싶은 레이어 선택
  3. 원본 언어와 번역할 언어 선택
  4. 번역 스타일 선택
  5. '번역하기' 버튼 클릭
plugins.tagline: Claude AI로 Figma 디자인의 텍스트를 자연스럽게 번역하세요.

plugins.name: Convert To Bionic Writing
plugins.description:
Unlock Faster, More Focused Reading with Bionic Reading: This plugin applies the Bionic Reading method (bionic-reading.com) to your text layers, dynamically bolding the initial letters of words to improve reading speed and comprehension. By leveraging the natural fixation points of the eye, Bionic Reading helps readers process text more efficiently with less cognitive effort. This plugin works best with fonts that offer multiple weight variations.


Key Features:


  1. Converts selected text layers to Bionic Reading format.
  2. Optimizes text for faster and more focused reading.
  3. Ideal for improving readability and engagement.



Open Source: github.com/mrayubmuhammad/Convert-To-Bionic-Writing-Figma-Plugin



Created by d3flow (www.d3flow.com) using Claude.ai.

Note: Requires fonts with multiple weight options for optimal performance.

accepted.description: Cofounder at d3flow where we Design, Develop and Distribute in flow.

plugins.name: Find Components
plugins.description:
このFigmaプラグイン「Find Components」は、選択した複数のレイヤーの中からメインコンポーネント/インスタンスを効率的に選出するのに役立ちます。


主な機能：

  1. メインコンポーネント/インスタンスの絞り込み： 選択したレイヤーの中から、メインコンポーネント/インスタンスのみを抽出して選択できます。
  2. 検索結果をリスト化： 抽出されたコンポーネントが検索結果としてリスト化され、レイヤー名をクリックするとそのレイヤーがクローズアップ表示されます。
  3. コンポーネントを集める： 実行すると選択中のメインコンポーネントがインスタンスに置き換わり、新しいページにメインコンポーネントが移動します。
  4. 選択対象の切り替え：ドロップダウンメニューから、メインコンポーネント/インスタンスのどちらを選択対象とするかを選択できます。
  5. グループ化されたレイヤーにも対応： グループ化されたレイヤーの奥深くにネストされたコンポーネント/インスタンスも探し出して選択できます。
  6. 処理のキャンセル： 実行処理が重い場合でも、途中で処理をキャンセルできます。


このプラグインは、以下のような場面で役立ちます：

  1. デザインシステムの整理： 大量のコンポーネント/インスタンスの中から、特定のものを効率的に見つけたい場合。
  2. デザインの更新： 複数のインスタンスをまとめてメインコンポーネントにリンクさせたい場合。
  3. 共同作業： チームメンバーが作成したコンポーネントやインスタンスを、効率的に把握したい場合。


---


This Figma plugin, "Find Components," helps you efficiently identify main components and instances from multiple selected layers.


Key Features:

  1. Filter Main Components/Instances: Extract and select only the main components or instances from the selected layers.
  2. List Search Results: The extracted components are displayed as a list. Clicking on a layer name will zoom into that specific layer.
  3. Gather Components: When executed, selected main components are replaced with instances, and the main components are moved to a new page.
  4. Toggle Target Type: Choose whether to target main components or instances from a dropdown menu.
  5. Support for Nested Layers: Even components/instances deeply nested within grouped layers can be found and selected.
  6. Cancel Processing: You can cancel the process at any time, even if the operation is heavy.


This plugin is useful in the following scenarios:

  1. Organizing Design Systems: Efficiently find specific components or instances among a large number of them.
  2. Updating Designs: Batch-link multiple instances to their corresponding main components.
  3. Collaborative Work: Quickly identify components or instances created by team members.

plugins.name: TapTail
plugins.description:
😌 No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!


Have you ever wanted to know if the Figma proto you shared was opened? To see where people clicked? To get insights how your proto works? Read on 👇


Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


💬 Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

♥️ Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


————————


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


————————


🛟 How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important ❗️).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


————————


⏳ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you 🤗


————————


🔐 Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/…) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. – for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


————————


🚧 Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, …);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


————————


🪳 Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


————————


🫶 Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets

plugins.name: Select Matching Layers in Frame
plugins.description:
Instantly find repeated frames or component instances within the same frame and edit them all at once.


Figma’s built-in “Select Matching Layers” feature only works across different frames. This plugin is similar but works within a single frame. Quickly select repeating elements within a single frame and adjust their properties, just like the multi-edit feature. For convenience I recommend setting up a custom shortcut for the plugin.


Pair with Master plugin

Turn matching layers into a single component in seconds with the Master plugin:

1. Use Select Matching Layers in Frame to find all repeated elements

2. Run Master → Create Component from Objects

3. Done. You’ll get a single, clean component with overrides preserved


Technical details:

  1. Select all instances of a component (including variants) when selecting an instance
  2. Select all layers with matching name and type when selecting any other layer
  3. Searches within the same frame only
  4. Select multiple objects within different frames, plugin will find all the matches


If you have any questions or feedback, please comment below!
plugins.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame

plugins.name: Sync Variables with Notion
plugins.description:
Synchronizes variables from a Notion database to a Figma document's Variable Collection. This is particularly useful for managing application text in Notion or supporting multiple languages.


🔥 How to use


Sync collection tab

Connects a Notion database to a Figma Variable Collection and synchronizes their values. Settings are saved per Figma document.


1. Database ID

Specify the Notion database ID (Reference).


2. Integration token

First, create a new integration in Notion (Reference). Next, grant your integration page permissions (Reference). Enter the copied token.


3. Key property name

Specify the name of the Notion property that serves as the unique key for the variables (e.g., Name, Key, ID). Currently, title, formula, and text properties are supported as keys.


4. Collection name to create or update

Specify the name of the Figma Variable Collection to sync with. Existing local collection names will be suggested via autocomplete. If the specified collection doesn't exist, it will be created.


5. Add or reorder modes

Specify the Notion property names that correspond to Figma Variable Modes. These properties will hold the variable values for each mode (e.g., language).


  1. Adding modes:
  2. Enter a mode name in the textbox (e.g., ja, en, or other property names in your Notion database).
  3. Click the "Add" button to add it to the list.
  4. Reordering modes: Modes in the list can be reordered via drag and drop. This order will be reflected in the order of Figma variable modes.
  5. Removing modes: Click the X icon to the right of each mode name to remove that mode from the list.


After entering the information for steps 1-4, click the "Sync variable collection with Notion" button to start the synchronization. This process might take some time depending on the number of items in the database and the variables.


List tab

About list tab

Displays variables from the selected Collection. Only STRING type variables applicable to TEXT_CONTENT are shown. You can copy keys and values, and filter the list by key or value. Clicking on a row reveals the button described below.


"Apply variable to selected text" button

Select text layers in Figma and click the button to apply the variable.


Display mode

Select the Variable Mode (e.g., language) to display its corresponding values in the list.


About caching

When the target collection is a library collection, this plugin caches its information in client storage. This is done because fetching library collections with many variables can be time-consuming and might hit Figma's API rate limits. Clicking the "Refresh" button clears the cache and fetches the latest variable data.


Utilities tab

Provides several utility actions to help manage variables and their application to text layers.


Target collection

Select the Variable Collection to target for the actions. You can choose a collection or all collections.


Target text range

Select the scope for the actions: "Selection", "Current page", or "All pages". You can also choose whether to include text layers within components ("Include text within components") or instances ("Include text within instances") using the respective checkboxes.


Limit variable name

Optionally, enter text here to limit the "Bulk apply variables" action to only those variables whose names contain the specified text.


"Bulk apply variables" button

Automatically applies variables to text layers within the selected range. It matches text content with variable values across all modes in the target collection(s).


"Highlight applied variables" button

Visualizes variable usage on text layers. Text layers with variables applied are highlighted in blue, while those without are highlighted in red.


📮 Support

If you have any problems or feedback, please use the GitHub Issues.


===


This plugin was created by Ryo Nakae 🙎‍♂️.


https://brdr.jp

https://x.com/ryo_dg

https://github.com/ryonakae
plugins.tagline: Sync text from Notion database to variable collection of Figma.

- Refactored code to improve processing speed and stability
- Fixed an issue where caching would fail when selecting library collections with thousands of variables (now displays variable lists without caching)

plugins.name: Schemator
plugins.description:
Schemator provides a flexible schema for your components helping you build code connect and write further tooling on it.


  1. Consistent Naming - Establish a universal schema for component properties, promoting seamless collaboration and code integration across teams and projects.
  2. Predictable Structure - Adopt a familiar and logical naming convention, ensuring that components are intuitive to use and easy to extend.
  3. Sanitized Definitions - Enable customization by adding suffixes and prefixes to property definitions, giving developers the flexibility to tailor components to their specific workflows.


Schemator is full open sourced, feel free to make changes to the rules and logic as you like 😀
plugins.tagline: Strucutre schema of your Figma components

plugins.name: Mailman for Klaviyo
plugins.description:
Streamline your email design workflow by seamlessly exporting Figma designs to Klaviyo. Perfect for agencies and brands managing multiple Klaviyo accounts. Key features:


  1. Direct export from Figma to Klaviyo with preserved design fidelity
  2. Support for multiple Klaviyo account management
  3. Save and reuse HTML templates and blocks
  4. Time-saving workflow for agencies and marketing teams


Whether you're an agency handling multiple client accounts or a brand maintaining email templates, this plugin bridges the gap between Figma design and Klaviyo implementation. Save time on manual exports and focus on creating emails.
plugins.tagline: Export Figma email designs directly to Klaviyo

plugins.name: Responsive Font-Size Generator (CSS clamp)
plugins.description:
Generate perfect CSS clamp() values for responsive typography in seconds


Transform your Figma text elements into production-ready responsive CSS with intelligent clamp() value generation. Select any text element and get perfectly scaled typography that works beautifully across all devices.


✨ Key Features

  1. Smart Typography Scaling: Mobile-first approach with 75-80% reduction for optimal readability
  2. Intelligent Variable Naming: Automatically suggests semantic CSS variable names (--h1-base, --h2-base, etc.)
  3. One-Click Workflow: Select text → Copy clamp value → Paste into CSS
  4. Container Query Ready: Uses modern cqw units for fluid responsive design
  5. Clean Output: Production-ready CSS with no unnecessary trailing zeros


🎨 Example Output

--h1-base: clamp(1.88rem, 4.2cqw, 2.5rem);
--h2-base: clamp(1.5rem, 4.2cqw, 2rem);
--text-xl: clamp(1rem, 2.2cqw, 1.25rem);

No more manual calculations or responsive typography headaches – just perfect clamp values, every time.


🔗 Also check out our Figma to Oxygen Builder Plugin for complete design-to-WordPress conversion!


wpconverters.com
plugins.tagline: Get perfect responsive Font-Size properties
